Docs.summary: The allows you to manipulate Azure Storage service resources and shares. The storage account provides the top-level namespace for the File service.

Docs.param: The name of the share to delete.
A value indicating whether to delete a share's snapshots in addition to the share itself.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
Marks the specified share or share snapshot for deletion. The share or share snapshot and any files contained within it are later deleted during garbage collection.
Currently, this method will always delete snapshots. There's no way to specify a separate value for x-ms-delete-snapshots.
For more information, see .
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.

Docs.param: The file service properties.
Optional to propagate notifications that the operation should be cancelled.
Docs.summary:
The operation sets properties for a storage account’s File service endpoint, including properties for Storage Analytics, CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) rules and soft delete settings. You can also use this operation to set the default request version for all incoming requests to the File service that do not have a version specified.
For more information, see .
Docs.returns: A if the operation was successful.
Docs.remarks: A will be thrown if a failure occurs.
